file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 25-27-02-04 - CONFIG-2 - FORWARD BAGGAGE COMPARTMENT PARTITION - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL FORWARD BAGGAGE COMPARTMENT PARTITION - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: ACFT MODEL(S) EMB-135 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove/install the forward baggage-compartment partition. B. The forward baggage-compartment partition is installed in the forward section of the baggage compartment, in zones 271 and 272. C. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY ACFT MODEL(S) FORWARD BAGGAGE-COMPARTMENT 25-27-02-000-801-A EMB-135 PARTITION - REMOVAL ACFT MODEL(S) FORWARD BAGGAGE-COMPARTMENT 25-27-02-400-801-A EMB-135 PARTITION - INSTALLATION EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General CONFIG-2 25-27-02 Page 1 of 10 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 25-27-02-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ACFT MODEL(S) EMB-135 2. FORWARD BAGGAGE-COMPARTMENT PARTITION - REMOVAL A. General (1) This task gives the procedures to remove the forward baggage-compartment partition. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM SDS 52-30-00/1 AMM TASK 25-40-01-000-801-A/400 - AMM TASK 25-40-04-000-801-A/400 TOILET SHROUD ASSEMBLY - REMOVAL AMM TASK 25-50-02-000-801-A/400 CARGO NET ASSEMBLY - REMOVAL AMM TASK 38-10-01-000-801-A/400 WATER TANK - REMOVAL AMM TASK 38-10-07-000-801-A/400 - AMM TASK 38-10-07-000-802-A/400 - AMM TASK 38-32-01-000-801-A/400 TOILET UNIT - REMOVAL SRM 51-20-01 - C. Zones and Accesses Not Applicable D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 2 Do the task Lavatory/baggage compartment I. Removal (Figure 401) SUBTASK 020-012-B (1) At the lavatory, remove the forward baggage-compartment partition, as follows: (a) Remove the toilet shroud assembly (1) ( AMM TASK 25-40-04-000-801-A/400). Refer to DET. A, Figure 401, sheet 1. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 CONFIG-2 25-27-02 Page 2 of 10 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (b) Remove the toilet unit (2) ( AMM TASK 38-32-01-000-801-A/400). Refer to DET. A, Figure 401, sheet 1. (c) Remove the sealant from around RH partition (3) and the LH partition (4) (SRM 51-20-01). Refer to DET. A, Figure 401, sheet 1. (d) Remove the sealant from around the plumbing access cover assembly (SRM 51-20-01). Refer to DET. A, Figure 401, sheet 1. (e) Remove the RH cabinet (5) (AMM TASK 25-40-01-000-801-A/400). Refer to DET. B, Figure 401, sheet 2. (f) Remove the mirror (6), attached with velcro, from the sink cabinet. Refer to DET. B, Figure 401, sheet 2. (g) Pull the plumbing access panel (7) at the sink cabinet. Refer to DET. B, Figure 401, sheet 2. (h) Pull the plumbing access cover assembly (8) that is attached with velcro. Refer to DET. B, Figure 401, sheet 2. (i) Loosen the fill line mid section 2 (9) at the RH partition and LH partition (AMM TASK 38-10-07-000-801-A/400 or AMM TASK 38-10-07-000-802-A/400), as applicable. Refer to DET. B, Figure 401, sheet 2. (j) Loosen the overflow line mid section 2 (10) at the RH partition and LH partition (AMM TASK 38-10-07-000-801-A/400 or AMM TASK 38-10-07-000-802-A/400), as applicable. Refer to DET. B, Figure 401, sheet 2. (k) Pull the amenity dispenser (12). Refer to DET. D, Figure 401, sheet 2. (l) Remove the water tank (11) ( AMM TASK 38-10-01-000-801-A/400). Refer to DET. D, Figure 401, sheet 2. (m) Remove the screws (19, 21 and 23) and washers (20, 22 and 24) that attach the sink cabinet (18) at the RH partition assembly. Refer to DET. E, Figure 401, sheet 3. (n) Remove the cable column cover assembly (13) that is attached with velcro. Refer to DET. C, Figure 401, sheet 2. (o) For aircraft with baggage compartment light lavatory switch, disconnect the splices (17). Refer to DET. C, Figure 401, sheet 2. (p) NOTE: Be careful with the rudder cables and elevator cables to prevent injury to persons and damage to the parts. Remove the screws (15) and washers (16) that attach the cable protection shroud (14). Refer to DET. C, Figure 401, sheet 2. (2) At the baggage compartment (refer to DET. F, Figure 401, sheet 3), remove the forward baggage-compartment partition as follows: (a) Open the baggage door (AMM SDS 52-30-00/1) to get access to the baggage compartment. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 CONFIG-2 25-27-02 Page 3 of 10 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (b) Remove the cargo restraint net ( AMM TASK 25-50-02-000-801-A/400). (c) Remove the bolts (25) and washer (26) that attach the LH partition. (d) Remove the bolts (27) and washers (28) that attach the RH partition. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 CONFIG-2 25-27-02 Page 4 of 10 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

BOLT EM145AMM250411A.DGN EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 CONFIG-2 25-27-02 Page 7 of 10 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 25-27-02-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ACFT MODEL(S) EMB-135 3. FORWARD BAGGAGE-COMPARTMENT PARTITION - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This task gives the procedures to install the forward baggage-compartment partition. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM SDS 52-30-00/1 AMM TASK 25-40-01-400-801-A/400 - AMM TASK 25-40-04-400-801-A/400 TOILET SHROUD ASSEMBLY - INSTALLATION AMM TASK 25-50-02-400-801-A/400 CARGO NET ASSEMBLY - INSTALLATION AMM TASK 38-10-01-400-801-A/400 WATER TANK - INSTALLATION AMM TASK 38-10-07-400-801-A/400 - AMM TASK 38-10-07-400-802-A/400 - AMM TASK 38-32-01-400-801-A/400 TOILET UNIT - INSTALLATION SRM 51-20-01 - C. Zones and Accesses Not Applicable D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials SPECIFICATION DESCRIPTION QTY (BRAND) RTV157 (Gray) Sealant AR RTV780 (White) Sealant AR G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 2 Do the task Lavatory/baggage compartment EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 CONFIG-2 25-27-02 Page 8 of 10 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL I. Installation (Figure 401) SUBTASK 420-012-B (1) At the baggage compartment, install the forward baggage-compartment partition (refer to DET. F, Figure 401, sheet 3) as follows: (a) Install the LH partition with the bolts (25) and washers (26). (b) Install the RH partition with the bolts (27) and the washers (28). (c) Install the cargo restraint net ( AMM TASK 25-50-02-400-801-A/400). (d) Close the baggage door (AMM SDS 52-30-00/1). (2) At the Lavatory, install the forward baggage-compartment partition, as follows: (a) NOTE: Be careful with the rudder cables and elevator cables to prevent injury to persons and damage to the parts. Install the cable protection shroud (14) with the screws (15) and washers (16). Refer to DET. C, Figure 401, sheet 2. (b) For aircraft with baggage compartment light lavatory switch, connect the splices (17). Refer to DET. C, Figure 401, sheet 2 (c) Install the cable column cover assembly (13) over the cable protection shroud (14) with velcro. Refer to DET. C, Figure 401, sheet 2. (d) Install the sink cabinet (18) to the RH partition with the screws (19, 21 and 23) and washers (20, 22 and 24). Refer to DET. E, Figure 401, sheet 3. (e) Install the water tank (11) ( AMM TASK 38-10-01-400-801-A/400). Refer to DET. D, Figure 401, sheet 2. (f) Fit the amenity dispenser (12). Refer to DET. D, Figure 401, sheet 2. (g) Fit the over flow line mid section 2 (10) at the RH partition and LH partition (AMM TASK 38-10-07-400-801-A/400 or AMM TASK 38-10-07-400-802-A/400), as applicable. Refer to DET. B, Figure 401, sheet 2. (h) Fit the fill line mid section 2 (9) at the RH partition and LH partition (AMM TASK 38-10-07-400-801-A/400 or AMM TASK 38-10-07-400-802-A/400), as applicable. Refer to DET. B, Figure 401, sheet 2. (i) Fit the plumbing access cover assembly (8) with velcro. Refer to DET. B, Figure 401, sheet 2. (j) Fit the plumbing access panel (7) at the sink cabinet. Refer to DET. B, Figure 401, sheet 2. (k) Install the mirror (6) to the sink cabinet with velcro. Refer to DET. B, Figure 401, sheet 2. (l) Install the RH cabinet (5) (AMM TASK 25-40-01-400-801-A/400). Refer to DET. B, Figure 401, sheet 2. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 CONFIG-2 25-27-02 Page 9 of 10 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (m) Apply the sealant around the plumbing access cover assembly. Refer to DET. A, Figure 401, sheet 1. (n) Apply the sealant around the RH partition (3) and LH partition (4) (SRM 51-20-01). Refer to DET. A, Figure 401, sheet 1. (o) Install the toilet unit (2) ( AMM TASK 38-32-01-400-801-A/400). Refer to DET. A, Figure 401, sheet 1. (p) Install the toilet shroud assembly (1) ( AMM TASK 25-40-04-400-801-A/400). Refer to DET. A, Figure 401, sheet 1. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 CONFIG-2 25-27-02 Page 10 of 10 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
